adrFormatAddress: One Un Plaza, New York, NY 10017, USA

editorialSummary.text: Upscale hotel with a contemporary American restaurant & a bar, plus a gym.

originalText.text: Very nice rooms, excellent views, excellent location close to restaurants, coffee shops, and very quiet. However, the $30 per day resort fee is a gimmick and really should just be added to the daily rate as it created more issues for the staff to help customers understand how much per day they’ve already spent. If you don’t remember to use your $30 resort credit you lose it. This needs to be altered for better customer experience. We spent more time trying to figure out if we’ve used up our $30 resort fee then actually enjoying our stay.

originalText.text: Horrible hotel. The room was absolutely dirty. No housekeeping ever took place in that room. I called to complain because they also had no toilet paper or ice available. They told me that I got a good price for the room. Especially in that area. $250 per night, $100 parking, $30 fee!! Yeah! Great price!!

text.text: Horrible hotel. The room was absolutely dirty. No housekeeping ever took place in that room. I called to complain because they also had no toilet paper or ice available. They told me that I got a good price for the room. Especially in that area. $250 per night, $100 parking, $30 fee!! Yeah! Great price!!

originalText.text: We can't really talk about the service because we were visiting relatives that were staying there, but they were very happy with their room upgrade. The views of the city were phenomenal. They're their suite was gorgeous! However, the food in the shop was ridiculously expensive. $28 and 29.00 for a salad or a sandwich.

text.text: We can't really talk about the service because we were visiting relatives that were staying there, but they were very happy with their room upgrade. The views of the city were phenomenal. They're their suite was gorgeous! However, the food in the shop was ridiculously expensive. $28 and 29.00 for a salad or a sandwich.

originalText.text: I was very excited about this weekend trip with my husband and two children due to the location and the price point. However, that changed once I arrived. To park my vehicle, I was told it was only valet and it was $100 per night and there was no in and out privileges. I came to find out the reason for no in and out privileges was because my vehicle was parked on the street. So, I basically paid for my vehicle to be parked on the street that was free until Monday (How awesome is that??). Next the older black woman at the front desk with the salt and pepper hair in a bun looked at me and my family like we had three heads because we were dressed comfortable versus business attire/glamorous evening wear, but I guess I shouldn't take offense because that's how she looked at another young black couple as well (I guess we didn't fit the description of the typical guests...foreign or Caucasian). There is no ice machines or vending machines, and the store closes early so if you wake up thirsty in the middle of the night...tap water is your only option. I booked a double bedroom because I had no idea it was double full-size beds. My husband booked an additional night before check out time so we could just stay in our room and then transition to the new upgraded room upon check in. I advised the front desk of the booked additional night and was still charged $75 for three hours late check out after we were advised that we had to leave our room because our current room needed to be cleaned and our new room wasn't available. (So why did I still get charged $75??!!) We had to take all of our things to the bell person who had nowhere to house our food that was in the refrigerator so that was $150 down the drain. They add an extra $30 to your room and say it's a credit for food and beverage but you lose it by 11am the next day. Also, every entree is nearly $30 so if you have a family this deal is a no go. Overall, the room and hotel were very clean it's the snobby staff and extra fees that are the issue.

originalText.text:
!!!! Hidden charges… BE AWARE!!!!!

My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel during our most recent visit. She booked us a Corner King room. When we arrived for check in… the line was incredibly backed up. And only 2 people working the check in counter. When we finally made it through check in, I put my card on file for the stay, and I was charged the rate for the room and then a $300 security deposit for the room, which I verified that I would get back after our visit. She said yes the pending charge should fall off as long as we don’t “use” anything, which kind of caught me off guard.

We got into our room, and for the most part.. it was alright. We had a great view of both midtown and uptown. However, one of the lights in the wardrobe was broken and the wires hanging down; and the door to that same wardrobe did not shut properly. Our visit was okay for the most part.

We booked through Travelocity, which outlined all the upfront charges (the room, taxes, and the $30 resort fee.) After all was said and done, our visit should have been $644.43. After our stay ended, I was of course charged the room rate of $554.43 and should’ve only been charged $90 for the “resort fee”. However, I noticed an additional charge on my account of $167.04. On this bill included the $30 “urban destination fee” which is the resort fee. However, I was charged $81.76 for the Ambassador Bar Breakfast?  we did NOT even step foot in that place during our visit. We chose to get food from outside the hotel at a bodega, so why am I being charged for eating at the Ambassador bar and grill? Also; they give you $30 “credit” to use at the mini cafe; however I think I was ALSO charged for that.l

My girlfriend and I have both been calling to get clarification on these charges, however we kept getting passed on to other managers who aren’t even in office. My girlfriend spoke to Kristal who I guess is the Front Desk manager and when my girlfriend asked her about the suspicious charges, Kristal became defensive and said the conversation was headed in the “wrong direction.”

Overall, very shady charges at this hotel. I don’t think we will stay here when we can pay the money and get more “bang for our buck”
